content.description: If you are at the upper shelter, look over to the school. Follow it to the back and you have a great wall to traverse back and forth.  Easy warm up.
content.protection: There is grass in the summer but I would still have a spotter and a pad.

content.description: Outer side of the shelter right by a fence.  Start inside, and traverse low and then topout at the end.
content.protection: Crashpad and spotter will be fine

content.description: If you like little edges and crimps you will have to try this.  It is at the upper shelter.  Either of the inside walls with fire places.
I think the start would be the hardest.  This is a traverse, and you hug the wall while going around it.  About 50 feet front and back.  Very good warm up.
content.protection: I would get a pad and a spotter to follow you around the wall with

content.description: Hoyt Park is a very nice wooded park area and I went to middle school right next to the park.  They have two shelters worth bouldering. The upper shelter is packed with little edges and crimps that you will need climbing shoes with. The lower shelter is a packed playground of 4 walls with good edges and some big ledges perfect for a traverse.  There is also tons of hiking all around the park.
